com.radiusnetworks.proximity.ibeacon.startup
Class RegionBootstrap

java.lang.Object
  com.radiusnetworks.proximity.ibeacon.startup.RegionBootstrap

public class RegionBootstrap
extends java.lang.Object

Class allowing a user to set up background launching of an app when a user enters an iBeacon Region. Simply constructing and holding a reference to this class will cause background scanning for iBeacons to start on Android device startup. If a matching iBeacon is detected, the BootstrapNotifier didEnterRegion method will be called, allowing the application to launch an Activity, send a local notification, or perform any other action desired. IMPORTANT NOTE: The RegionBootstrap class registers an internal MonitorNotifier with the IBeaconManager. If you use the RegionBootstrap, your application must not manually register a second MonitorNotifier, otherwise it will unregister the one configured by the RegionBootstrap, effectively disabling it. When using the RegionBootstrap, any custom monitoring code must must therefore be placed in the callback methods in the BootsrapNotifier implementation passed to the RegionBootstrap.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

RegionBootstrap

public RegionBootstrap(BootstrapNotifier application,
                       Region region)
Constructor to bootstrap your Application on an entry/exit from a single region. Do not use this class if you are using the ProximityKitManager, because equivalent functionality is built-in to that class will cause conflicts. If using ProximityKitManager, ensure that the start method is called in the onCreate method of your Application class to enable equivalent functionality.

Parameters:
application -
region -

                       java.util.List regions)
Constructor to bootstrap your Application on an entry/exit from multiple regions

Parameters:
application -
regions -
Method Detail

disable

public void disable()
Used to disable additional bootstrap callbacks after the first is received. Unless this is called, your application will be get additional calls as the supplied regions are entered or exited.
